description:
After the announcement of the first direct detection of gravitational
waves on February 2016, the Virgo Collaboration is thriving to complete
the integration and commissioning of the Advanced Virgo detector in
order to provide, as soon as possible, its decisive contribution to the
international network of gravitational wave detectors. Having at least
three detectors working simultaneously is essential for the localization
of the sources in the sky. In this talk I will present an overview on
the status of the Advanced Virgo detector highlighting the challenges
encountered during its commissioning and how Python is helping in facing
them in particular for the detector supervisory control automation.
title: Python and the Commissioning of the Advanced Virgo Gravitational Waves Detector
